messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/8/02 11:56:47 AM, leschke@islandnet.com writes:   I ... -=-Sorry.  I know this is serious......but I couldn t help imagining her
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/8/02 11:56:47 AM, leschke@... writes:

<< > I
>pulled her aside and talked to her, asked her to walk in the back yard or
>lick a ball back there until she felt calmer and in control od herself

-=-Sorry. I know this is serious......but I couldn't help imagining her
*licking* the ball. Must have cracked everyone up. <g> >>

Better that she came back out and licked the neighbor boy!! <woohoo, archaic
English!>
[Except for the phrase still out there from a watch commercial, "takes a
lickin' and keeps on tickin'," I'm pretty sure my kids wouldn't know the
phrase "a lickin." They used it on the Simpsons once, when Bart was Tom
Sawyer and Milhouse (I think) said "Whitewashin' sucks, Tom--it POWERful
sucks."]

THERE is some 19th century education for you. :->

Sadnra
